message_1: Find the solution set for the inequality 2x + 5 > 9 on the number line.
message_2:
To find the solution set for the inequality 2x + 5 > 9, we first need to isolate the variable x.

1. Subtract 5 from both sides of the inequality:
2x + 5 - 5 > 9 - 5
2x > 4

2. Divide both sides by 2:
2x / 2 > 4 / 2
x > 2

The solution set for the inequality is x > 2. On the number line, this would be represented by an open circle at 2 and an arrow pointing to the right, indicating all values greater than 2 are part of the solution set.
